001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.capture.libpcap;
002
003/**
004 * High-level wrapper around libpcap operations used by RADAR.
005 * <p>Implementations bridge to native libraries via {@link JnrLibpcap}.</p>
006 *
007 * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
008 */
009public interface Pcap extends AutoCloseable {
010  /**
011   * Opens a live capture handle for the specified interface.
012   *
013   * @param iface network interface name
014   * @param snapLen snapshot length in bytes
015   * @param promiscuous whether to enable promiscuous mode
016   * @param timeoutMs read timeout in milliseconds
017   * @param bufferBytes capture buffer size in bytes
018   * @param immediate {@code true} to enable immediate mode
019   * @return activated capture handle
020   * @throws PcapException if any libpcap call fails
021   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
022   */
023  PcapHandle openLive(String iface, int snapLen, boolean promiscuous,
024                      int timeoutMs, int bufferBytes, boolean immediate) throws PcapException;
025
026  /**
027   * Opens an offline capture handle backed by a pcap/pcapng file.
028   *
029   * @param file pcap or pcapng file path
030   * @param snapLen snapshot length in bytes used to clamp returned payloads
031   * @return activated capture handle
032   * @throws PcapException if libpcap fails to open or validate the file
033   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
034   */
035  PcapHandle openOffline(java.nio.file.Path file, int snapLen) throws PcapException;
036
037  /**
038   * Returns the libpcap version string.
039   *
040   * @return libpcap version string
041   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
042   */
043  String libVersion();
044
045  /**
046   * Callback invoked for each captured packet.
047   *
048   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
049   */
050  interface PacketCallback {
051    /**
052     * Handles a captured packet.
053     *
054     * @param tsMicros capture timestamp in microseconds since epoch
055     * @param data captured frame bytes (length may exceed {@code capLen})
056     * @param capLen number of valid bytes in {@code data}
057     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
058     */
059    void onPacket(long tsMicros, byte[] data, int capLen);
060  }
061}
